intro: Mozinna canescens, commonly known as the gray mozkva, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, grayish-green foliage and small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant is native to Central Asia and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a taproot system and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
